comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Steve's right; it's a faculty flood zone. I've sandbagged the low-lying areas around my office, but I don't suspect that will hold much longer. I'm actually preparing to evacuate, grabbing personal records, family photos, and cherished momentos (my MIDOL mousepad). BTW, I really like the wall o' bikes. Reminds me of the [floor o' people.](http://adsoftheworld.com/media/ambient/frontline_mall?size=_original) Toward a more just and verdant world, DU

comments.author: Werner
comments.body: I'm starting to think the "Auteurs" frame on the lower right part of the Frenzy is not accurate. A few days ago it showed that Greg Stauffer had 8 posts, Dave Underwood had 88, and Steve had 888. That seemed like a cool coincidence. However if you look at it today, it appears that Dave Underwood has somehow lost a post. He's _down_ to 87. What gives? Mark.

comments.author: Steve
comments.body: Mark, if there were a Frenzy award for "Most Careful Reader of the Frenzy" you'd win! The reason Dave "lost" a post was that I re-filed his "Black Cats" story in a forthcoming Frenzy section called "Free Wheeling," wherein Frenz can submit short stories, essays, and the like. I'm very impressed that you even noticed! I've notified the trophy division.

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: It's significant, I think, that MW is both the Frenzy's most astute _and_ only reader. In that case, he's also the Frenzy's _least_ astute reader, right? Is this what you meant by a Gordian slipknot? DU

comments.author: Steve
comments.body: Great! Thanks to you, Dave, I now have to tell the trophy division to make two placards. There goes the 2010-2011-2012 budget!
